DOC.brief_summary: Evaluate the behavioral effects of ADDERALL XR versus STRATTERA under controlled conditions utilizing the SKAMP deportment scale.
DOC.brief_title: Analog Classroom Study Comparison of ADDERALL XR With STRATTERA in Children Aged 6-12 With ADHD
DOC.criteria: Primary diagnosis of ADHD combined subtype or predominantly hyperactiveimpulsive subtype, based on psychiatric evaluation Capable of understanding and following classroom instructions Generally functioning academically at ageappropriate levels ADHD, predominantly inattentive subtype Controlled or uncontrolled comorbid psychiatric diagnosis (except ODD) with significant symptoms such as PTSD, psychosis, bipolar disease, severe OCD, severe depressive or severe anxiety disorder Documented history of aggressive behavior serious enough to preclude participation in regular classroom activities Documented allergies or intolerance to either of the active treatments or tricyclic antidepressants
